thread.title: BOYS' TENNIS: Red Devils advance to state Final Four
thread.title_full: BOYS' TENNIS: Red Devils advance to state Final Four

author: hanson.crafton@newsandtribune.com(Hanson Crafton)
title: BOYS' TENNIS: Red Devils advance to state Final Four
text:
by Hanson Crafton 
CARMEL — With a solid effort by their doubles teams, the fourth-ranked Jeffersonville Red Devils knocked off No. 20 ranked Culver Academy 3-2 in Friday’s opening round of the state finals at Carmel. 
With the 3-2 win, Jeffersonville advances to the state Final Four. The Red Devils will lock up with No. 2 ranked North Central today. The Panthers upset No. 1 Carmel to advance to the semifinal round. 
Jeff and North Central are the state’s only two unbeaten teams. 
Culver took an early lead after last years state runner-up Sam Concannon beat Jeff’s Brock Winchell, 6-1, 6-0 to be the first off the court. 
“I felt Brock was very competitive, even though the score did not reflect how well he played,” Jeffersonville coach Mark Reilly said. “[Concannon] is still undefeated and played like a state champion.” 
Jeffersonville responded by wining the next three matches. 
Bradley Cross was the first Red Devil off the court. He got Jeffersonville started with a 6-2, 6-0 win over Joshua Thompkins in No. 3 singles. 
The Red Devils’s No. 2 doubles team of Keith Asplund and Blake Winchell were the next off after beating Culver’s Evan Dillion and Ean Anderson 6-2, 6-3. 
The clinching point came when Jeff’s No.1 doubles team of Jack Reilly and Sam Coward defeated the Culver duo of Brian Tao and William Billcic 6-2, 6-3. 
“Our crafty lefty, Sam, used the wind to make his serve highly effective,” Coach Reilly said. “Jack’s big forehand and kick serve provided a lot of easy points for put-away shots for Sam at the net.” 
Kooper Falkenstein saw his perfect season come to an end at the hands of Culvers’ Chris Bilicic 0-6, 6-4, 6-1. Falkenstein has had an amazing year and has been the constant for Jeff all year in the No. 2 spot. 
“He had such a big smile when the players went out on the court to celebrate, Reilly said of Falkenstein. “True character comes out after a defeat and Jeffersonville has a class act with Falkenstein on the court.” 
JEFFERSONVILLE 3, CULVER ACADEMIES 2 
At Indianapolis 
Singles: Sam Concannon (C) d. Brock Winchell 6-1, 6-0; Chris Bilicic (C) d. Kooper Falkenstein 0-6, 6-4, 6-1; Bradley Cross (J) d. Joshua Thompkins 6-2, 6-0. 
Doubles: Jackson Reilly-Sam Coward (J) d. Brian Tao-William Bilicic 6-4, 6-2; Keith Asplund-Blake Winchell (J) d. Evan Dillion-Ean Anderson 6-2, 6-3. 
STATE FINALS
